intro: Trachyandra dissecta, commonly known as the dissected trachyandra, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are finely dissected, giving it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, clustered in a spike at the center of the rosette. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique foliage and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
